label: Description
value: Large ovoid jar, tall straight-sided neck, slightly flattened foot; painted in underglaze blue on white with overall floral and bird pattern with leaf band bottom and floral reserve band at shoulder; high domed cover with wide flat base, acorn finial, decorated with floral and bird pattern.

label: Creator name
value: De Drie Posteleyne Astonne (The Three Porcelain Ash-Barrels)

label: Provenance
value: 1964: Walter Phelps Warren (from Jacques Goudstikker, Amsterdam; Baren M. Groen Antiques, Amsterdam); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Circular plate with wide rim, resting on short foot ridge; painted in underglaze blue on white with a scrolled floral border on rim and in center withscene of 3 men with staffs in landscape (Christ and disciples on road to Emmaus).

label: Provenance
value: 1965: Walter Phelps Warren (from A. Vecht (Antiques) Amsterdam); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Circular bowl with wide rim; painted in underglaze blue with dark outlines (trek), in center with chinoiserie bird and floral spray, around the rim with floral border; on back several rings of blue and trek circled around foot rim.

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1966: Baroness Van der Borch van Derwolde, the Netherlands; 1966: Walter Phelps Warren (from Nystad Antiquairs, The Hague); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Four-sided obelisk with molded bottom edge, ball finial, four ball feet; square base with molded top and bottom edges, four ball feet; painted in underglaze blue and yellow, on base with roundels each side, each with dragon or landscape, on top with reserves of flowers and landscapes.

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1966: Charles van der Heyden, Rotterdam; 1966: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Heart-shaped dish on short foot rim with slightly flared sides; painted in underglaze blue on white with birds and flowers in center, on sides with alternating panels of flowers and pseudo-Chinese characters.

label: Provenance
value: pre-1966: Charles van der Heyden, Rotterdam;  1966: Walter Phelps Warren;  1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Heart-shaped dish on short foot rim with slightly flaring sides; painted inunderglaze blue on white with birds and flowers in center, on sides with alternating panels of flowers and pseudo-Chinoiserie characters.

label: Provenance
value: pre-1966: Charles van der Heyden, Rotterdam; 1966: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Tall pear-shaped body on collet foot; hinged domed lid with ball finial; long, flat spout with shallow flutes, joined at bottom with shell mount; long hardwood loop handle joined at bottom with long tubular socket and at top with elaborate acanthus mount; beading around base of lid.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x diam.: 30.5 x 17 x 7 cm (12 x 6 11/16 x 2 3/4 in.) diam. (body): 8.5 cm (3 3/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Walter H. Wilson, Ltd., London; 1967 WPW

label: Description
value: Circular plate with deep cavetto, standing on short foot rim; painted in underglaze blue on white with overall scene of 4 figures in landscape (two seated, two standing), 2 large trees on right, a windmill and onion-domed tower background, spongework leaves.

label: Provenance
value: 1976: Walter Phelps Warren (from C. J. J. Weegenaar Antiquair, The Hague); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Flat circular top with raised gadrooned border at outer rim, on hollow stemmed domed base; painted in underglaze blue on white, on base with floral reserves on leafy border, on top with central rosette surrounded by scroll, lambrequin, and gadrooned borders, on underside with 4 groups of 4 dots.

label: Provenance
value: pre-1967: A. van `T Hof, Haarlem, Holland; 1967: Walter Phelps Warren (from Antiques Dealers' Fair, Delft); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Circular plate with wide rim; painted in underglaze blue on white with brick-red outer border; center has chinoiserie scene of bird, flowers; cavetto has diaper pattern with 5 floral reserves; outer rim has 5 floral sprays; back painted with 4 evenly-spaced squiggles.

label: Provenance
value: Kinch and Christensen, Copenhagen; 1968: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Tall rectangular body, sloping shoulders, round neck with top and bottom rim; painted in underglaze blue on white, on sides above cloud-band border with Chinese figures in landscapes and pavillions, on shoulders and neck with chinoiserie motifs; traces of gilding throughout.

label: Provenance
value: 1969: Walter Phelps Warren (from E. Van Dam, Rotterdam); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Eight-sided bowl on short foot; domed cover with ball finial; painted in underglaze blue on white, around body with Chinese pots and border of floral reserves, on cover with matching design, on finial with flower.

label: Provenance
value: A. van der Meer, Amsterdam; 1969: Walter Phelps Walter; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Tall reeded, 8-sided body, bulge at shoulder, tapered neck, slightly flared mouth; painted in underglaze blue on white with large stylized lotus leaf band around center, 3 smaller scroll bands surrounding, and floral/leaf sprays interspersed.

label: Provenance
value: A. Aronson, Amsterdam;  1970: Walter Phelps Warren (from Antique Dealer's Fair, Delft); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Tall reeded 8-sided body, bulge at shoulder, tapered neck, slightly flared mouth; painted in underglaze blue on white with large stylized lotus leaf band around center, 3 smaller scroll bands surrounding, and floral/leaf sprays interspersed.

label: Provenance
value: A. Aronson, Amsterdam; 1969: Walter Phelps Warren (from Antique Dealer's Fair, Delft); 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Eight-sided candlestick on domed base, rising to flattened cushion knop, tall shaft, turned-over lip; painted in underglaze blue on white with floral and lambrequin patterns on base, diaper motif on knop, 8 panels of floral/leaf pattern on shaft, scroll border on lip; rectangular hole on side under lip.

label: Provenance
value: A. Aronson, Amsterdam; 1971: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Set of 8 square tiles, each painted in underglaze blue on white with a different Biblical scene and "spider's head" corner motifs; mounted in wooden rectangular frame, 2 across, 4 down.

label: Description
value: Two-part, round; with dish-shaped upper part and shallow circular lower part with straight sides; two loop handles opposite sides; diamond-shaped shield on side; interior of base and bottom of top tinned.

label: Description
value: Cylindrical body with straight sides; 2 loop handles opposite sides; spout rises along side body, projects horizontally from squared shoulder; domed lid with wide lip and flattened knop finial; painted in underglaze blue on white with chinoiserie birds, flowers, scroll bands.

label: Provenance
value: R. and. J. Jones, London; 1976:  Walter Phelps Warren;  1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Ovoid body, short neck with everted rim; painted in underglaze blue on white with American Indian smoking a pipe, next to a large jar inscribed "Schosse," large tobacco plant overhead, crates and barrels left, one inscribed "VOC," two sailing ships on right.

label: Provenance
value: R. & J. Jones, London; 1977: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Oval plaque with molded border, 2 holes at top for hanging; painted in underglaze blue on white with grotesque decoration composed of fruit, birds, mask, lambrequin; around the border with a scroll pattern covered with blue; back plain.

label: Provenance
value: R. & J. Jones, London; 1983: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Circular plate with wide rim; painted in underglaze blue on white, center with chinoiserie scene of pavillion in landscape, cavetto with diaper pattern, outer rim with dot and line border.

label: Provenance
value: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Beaker-shaped body, flared towards top, flared base; cut with wide flutes bottom, a projecting hatched ring above, bands of flutes and strawberry diamonds above that, at top a wide band of swags engraved with an inscrip- tion, strawberry diamonds and fine diamonds above; rayed flutes on bottom.

label: Description
value: Ogee bowl, wide scalloped rim, cut in geometric pattern with row of printies at bottom; molded stem, ribbed and shouldered; domed base flared at the bottom with molded shouldered ribs; pontil mark bottom.

label: Provenance
value: W.G.T. Burne, London; 1959: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 4.7 x 15.2 cm (1 7/8 x 6 in.)

label: Description
value: Oval bowl with wide flared lip scalloped at edge; cut with star on bottom, row of printies around base; tall silver loop handle, lobed and engraved with floral motifs, ornate mounts at joining to bowl.

label: Description
value: 8-sided rectangular bowl, sides slightly flared, scalloped rim, sides cut with series of widely-spaced vertical lines; tall looped silver handle withshaped edges and engraved arabesques.

label: Description
value: Double ogee form, tall neck; flat circular base with scalloped edge, star cut on bottom; body cut with flat geometric patterns; silver(?) cover with straight sides, conical top, both with twisted incised lines; flame finial.  Glass has blue cast.

label: Description
value: Baluster shaped, with flaring rim and scalloped lip; short knopped stem, high stepped base; cut in strawberry diamond pattern all over with prismatic rings under lip, middle of sides and top of base; glass very reflective.

label: Provenance
value: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Round with low straight sides, horizontal rim top edge with egg and dart molding, stepped at base; turned wooden base with concentric grooves and central silver boss.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 4.7 x 15.2 cm (1 7/8 x 6 in.)

label: Description
value: Tall narrow flute on double spool stem wide flat foot; cut with vertical flat plates bottom, above with twisted panels of fine diamonds and facets.

label: Description
value: Double ogee-shaped bowl, ribbed, on tall multi-knopped stem; domed, ribbed base, folded over at edge; pontil mark base.

label: Provenance
value: Delomosne and Son, Ltd., London; 1961: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Double ogee bowl, flared at top, shaped rim and cut geometrical decoration;faceted knopped stem; domed base with cut facets and flat scalloped rim; pontil mark bottom.

label: Description
value: Slender urn-shaped body, cut with shallow diamond pattern all over, a row of thin fluting top edge, wider fluting at base; fluted stem on square base cut with star on bottom; tall bell-shaped cover cut with shallow diamonds and prismatic rings, faceted finial.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 33 x 11.8 cm (13 x 4 5/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Slender urn-shaped body cut with shallow diamond pattern all over, a row of thin fluting at top edge, wide flutes at base; fluted stem on square base cut with star on bottom; tall bell-shaped cover cut with shallow diamond pattern and prismatic rings, faceted finial.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 33 x 11.8 cm (13 x 4 5/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Trefoil-shaped base with applied molded rim, three ball feet; reeded frame for holding 3 decanters and stoppers, tall central circular handle.

label: Description
value: Length of damask, blue warp, white weft. Vertically symmetrical pattern with double-headed eagle, large flower in a pot and elephant. White pattern, the warp-float face of the satin. Blue background, the warp-float face of the satin.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 127 x 52.5 cm (50 x 20 11/16 in.) Repeat H x W: 35 x 11.7 cm (13 3/4 x 4 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Promotional handkerchief printed with several steps in the process of producing silk.  Hemmed on three sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed on plain weave foundation.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp: 21cm. (8 1/4 in. ) by weft (selvedge on right) 28cm (11in.)

label: Description
value: Urns of flowers with Chinese landscape scenes on the urns, in 7 colors.

label: Physical description
value: Technique: roller printed on cotton plain weave; printed by a machine with 7 rollers using both relief and engraved surfaces; glazed surface.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp; 231 cm (91in. - 7 ft. 7in) by weft (selvedge to selvedge) Pattern: Height of repeat: 13 3/4 in. Arranged as a half-drop. The rollers were wider than the fabric. 1 1/4 inches of the motif are missing from 2 full units of pattern.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Design of grapes, flowers, leaves and meandering stems in brown, blue, green, yellow, red, and white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 109.2 x 55.9 cm (43 x 22 in.) Repeat H (half-drop): 33 x 23.5 cm (13 x 9 1/4 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Notes
value: Design of grapes, flowers, leaves and meandering stems in brown, blue, green, yellow, red, and white.
